page.title: 12WOOLACOMBE CHURCH
page.content: The church of St Sabinus, as might be expected in a village of modern origin, was built in the early part of this century. The land was donated by Miss Chichester, who suggested the name St Sabinus, an Italian Bishop reputed to have sailed here from Ireland to convert the heathens. In fact the church was not completed until the 1960s. It is a large church for the size of the village, but in the summer the congregation is swelled with holidaymakers. The church became part of the Ilfracombe Team Ministry in 1977. The Electoral Roll is 65 and average attendance is 60. Sunday services are 8am Holy Communion and 10am Sung Eucharist.
